name: Government Spending Galore
title: Highest Government Expenditure as a Percentage of GDP
description: In 2022, Kiribati's government expenditure accounted for 61.53% of its GDP, the highest in the world, reflecting a significant focus on public sector spending.

name: Consumption Champions
title: Top Global Final Consumption Expenditure
description: Kiribati leads the world with a final consumption expenditure of 162.39% of GDP in 2022, indicating a high level of consumption relative to its economic output.

name: Education Investment Enthusiasts
title: High Government Expenditure on Education
description: In 2021, Kiribati allocated 14.20% of its GDP to education, showcasing a strong commitment to educational development.

name: Health Crisis Alert
title: High Mortality from Non-Communicable Diseases
description: With a mortality rate of 44.1% from diseases like CVD, cancer, and diabetes between ages 30 and 70 in 2021, Kiribati faces significant health challenges.

name: Youth Engagement Dilemma
title: High Youth Not in Education, Employment, or Training
description: In 2020, 53.67% of Kiribati's youth were not engaged in education, employment, or training, highlighting a critical area for policy intervention.

name: Aid Dependency
title: Reliant on Foreign Aid
description: In 2018, Kiribati received $9,999.99 in net bilateral aid from Sweden, highlighting its reliance on foreign assistance.

name: Minimal Methane
title: Negligible Methane Emissions
description: Kiribati's methane emissions from transport were a mere 0.0001 Mt CO2e in 2023, showcasing its minimal contribution to global emissions.

name: Debt-Free Zone
title: Negative Net Liabilities
description: In 2023, Kiribati had a net incurrence of liabilities at -3.04% of GDP, indicating a reduction in national debt.

name: Business Beginnings
title: Few New Businesses
description: Only 2 new businesses were registered in Kiribati in 2018, reflecting limited entrepreneurial activity.

name: Silent Lines
title: Sparse Telephone Subscriptions
description: With just 26 fixed telephone subscriptions in 2023, Kiribati has one of the lowest rates globally.

name: Export Challenges
title: Low Export Capacity
description: In 2023, Kiribati's exports of goods and services were valued at $20.57 million, indicating limited export activity.

name: Investment Insights
title: Modest Capital Formation
description: Gross fixed capital formation in Kiribati was $51.66 million in 2022, reflecting moderate investment levels.

name: Trade Deficit
title: Significant External Balance Deficit
description: Kiribati had an external balance on goods and services of -85.01% of GDP in 2023, highlighting a substantial trade deficit.

name: Service Sector Strength
title: Service Sector Dominance
description: In 2022, the service sector contributed $177.39 million to Kiribati's economy, underscoring its economic importance.

name: Income Insights
title: Low National Income
description: Kiribati's adjusted net national income was $359.69 million in 2021, indicating limited national wealth.

name: Savings Shortfall
title: Negative Domestic Savings
description: In 2022, Kiribati's gross domestic savings were -62.39% of GDP, reflecting a lack of national savings.

name: Healthcare Costs
title: Minimal Out-of-Pocket Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, Kiribati's out-of-pocket health expenditure per capita was $1.71, indicating low personal healthcare costs.

name: Tourism Tumble
title: Limited Tourism Receipts
description: In 2020, Kiribati earned $30,000 from international tourism, reflecting minimal tourism activity.

name: Import Insights
title: Negligible European Imports
description: In 2023, imports from Europe & Central Asia were just 0.003% of Kiribati's total merchandise imports, indicating limited trade with the region.

name: Agricultural Exports
title: Minimal Agricultural Exports
description: In 2021, agricultural raw materials made up only 0.0017% of Kiribati's merchandise exports, highlighting a limited agricultural export sector.

name: South Asia Trade
title: Negligible South Asian Exports
description: In 2019, exports to South Asia accounted for a mere 0.00003% of Kiribati's total merchandise exports, indicating minimal trade with the region.
